snippet: In Joseph J. Lhota’s Republican campaign for New York mayor, he faces the disadvantages of a late start, low name recognition and a huge Democratic registration edge.
abstract: Joseph J Lhota, in his Republican campaign for New York City mayor, faces disadvantages of a late start, low name recognition and huge Democratic registration edge; he has attracted wealthy donors, but biggest hurdle may be support claimed by Democratic City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and CHARLES V. BAGLI

lead_paragraph: In Joseph J. Lhota’s Republican campaign for New York mayor, he faces the disadvantages of a late start, low name recognition and a huge Democratic registration edge.

headline.seo: Lhota Draws Wealthy Donors, but High Hurdles Remain
headline.main: Latecomer in Mayor Race Has Business Titans’ Buzz
headline.print_headline: Republican’s Mayoral Bid Attracts Wealthy Donors, but High Hurdles Remain
